title: Enhancing Reusability of Learned Skills for Robot Manipulation via Gaze and Bottleneck
author: Ryo Takizawa (The University of Tokyo), Izumi Karino (The University of Tokyo), Koki Nakagawa (The University of Tokyo), Yoshiyuki Ohmura (The University of Tokyo), Yasuo Kuniyoshi (The University of Tokyo)
relevance_why: The study's insights on gaze-based object manipulation could inform similar approaches in audio-visual integration tasks, where spatial awareness and attention play crucial roles in performance.
background: This research involves training robots to perform complex manipulation tasks successfully, even when they encounter objects that were not present during training.
contribution: This paper introduces the Gaze-based Bottleneck-aware Robot Manipulation (GazeBot) framework to solve the problem of generalization in robot manipulation, achieving high reusability of learned skills in varied scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with generalizing manipulation skills to unseen object positions and end-effector poses, often requiring exhaustive demonstration datasets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes gaze-centered point clouds and a bottleneck-aware action segmentation approach, enabling robust learning that can adapt to different environmental conditions.

key_innovation: The method innovatively combines gaze tracking and bottleneck segmentation to enhance the reusability of robot manipulation skills, promoting better generalization under varying physical conditions.
real_world_impact: The framework holds potential for real-world applications in service robotics, where adaptability to diverse environments is crucial. Improved manipulation skills could lead to more effective human-robot interactions.
limitations: The study does not address limitations regarding gaze control adaptability under partial obfuscation of objects.

new_terms.gaze-centered point cloud: **Gaze-centered point cloud** refers to a 3D representation of the environment around where a robot's gaze is focused, allowing for improved spatial awareness and manipulation capabilities.
new_terms.bottleneck pose: **Bottleneck pose** indicates a critical point in a manipulation task where the robot transitions from a reaching phase to a more dexterous manipulation phase.

open_sourcing: Videos and code are available at https://crumbyrobotics.github.io/gazebot
